title.narrative: Filling the gap: Achieving living wages through improved transparency

description.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs subsidizes the development cooperation and global education projects of Finnish civil society organizations receiving EU funding by cofinancing which can be 50 % of the national share. Pro Ethical Trade Finland has together oth er actors reveived EuropeAid funding from the European Commission for a project called Filling the gap: Achieving Living Wages through improved transparency which strengthens living wages as the crucial leverage point to improve human rights in the garment and footwear value chains. The coordinator of the project is Stichting Schone Kleren Kampagne / Clean Clothes Campaign. Various tools are developped in order to increase the transparency by better knowledge and evidence base on living wages. Moreover camp aigns are organized in order to inform consumers workers labour market actors civil society organizations and decision makers in order to contribute to a better legal framework. The project is being carried out in three coutries in Asia (Indonesia India an d China) and in 11 countries in Europe (Holland Belgium Germany Austria Croatia Finland Italy Chech Republic Hungary Sweden). The project period is 2019-2022. The total budget of the project is 1 544 880 euros of which the share of the EU commission is 80 % at maximum which equals 1 235 904 euros and the national share of Pro Ethical Trade Finland is 11 171 euros for which a government subsidy of 5 586 euros is being applied.
